page.title: 01GENERAL VIEW OF BLACKHEAD
page.content: General view of Blackhead A lonely area with no through roads bounded by rocky cliffs facing south and east.There are three main farm clusters each with a couple of recent houses or bungalows built near them and two separate farms. Several recent villas and bungalows have been built along the road to Coverack to the north of the area mainly occupied by retired incomers. The Headland Hotel is on the edge of Coverack Village and the Drawbar club is a focal social point for a large area. There are approximately 25 family units. The National Trust has purchased about 1 Kilometre of Coastal land in the Downas valley.
